Vietnam‚Äôs tech transformation goes beyond its major hubs. Cities like Hue, Da Nang, Quy Nhon, Nha Trang, and Can Tho are emerging as rising stars in the country‚Äôs digital journey. Beyond travel destinations, these cities boast immense potential for tech infrastructure, smart city initiatives,
and data science research, semiconductors, and talent pool.

is leveraging this potential by making significant investments to foster a future-ready tech workforce and sustainable innovation, establishing them as innovation and off-shore delivery hubs.

 Discover how the cities are poised to redefine Vietnam‚Äôs tech landscape:

comments.commentText: Wow, looks like Vietnam's tech scene is going on a city tour!  From Hue to Can Tho, it's like the Avengers of tech innovation assembling across the country.  Can't wait to see these cities shine brighter than my laptop screen at 2 AM!  Kudos to FPT Software for leading the charge!

Exciting to see Vietnam's tech landscape expanding beyond its major hubs!  It's inspiring how cities like Hue, Da Nang, and Quy Nhon are becoming innovation hotspots. Kudos to FPT Software for investing in talent and sustainable innovation.  Looking forward to seeing how these initiatives shape the future of tech in Vietnam!

posts.name:
Mark R. Koesterer
Mark R. Koesterer
posts.content:
Day 25 the Rocky Steps challenge

Key Opportunities for Young Athletes on Linkedin

: The Undisputed Champion of Professional Networking
LinkedIn is an indispensable tool for any serious professional, especially athletes.
It's not just a platform; it's a dynamic ecosystem for:
* Building your professional brand: Showcase your skills, experience, and accomplishments.
* Connecting with industry leaders: Network with potential employers, mentors, and collaborators.
* Sharing your expertise: Amplify your voice and build thought leadership.
* Conducting in-depth research: Gain valuable insights into companies, industries, and potential career paths.

Every athlete, regardless of their sport or stage in their career, should leverage LinkedIn to:
* Expand their professional network: Connect with coaches, agents, scouts, and industry professionals.
* Explore career opportunities: Discover potential career paths beyond professional sports.
* Build their brand: Share their story, values, and aspirations with the world.

Don't let this powerful platform go to waste! You can start building your LinkedIn profile today.


You can listen to more of my thoughts HERE:

comments.commentText: Great points, Young athletes should use LinkedIn to open up doors for the future. Mark R.

posts.name:
Avik Ashar
Avik Ashar
posts.content:
We have officially hit peak f***ing AI. 

I just got pitched by:

> Someone making an AI comment engine, which reads through posts, premium can watch videos, then posts a comment

>> Someone making AI video making, from script generation to AI human talking, basically a full AI influencer

So effectively, AI makes, AI likes, Human ‚Ä¶ reads an actual made-from-paper book in Bali? (that's the dream).

However until we create basic human income and unlimited energy (where I REALLY REALLY hoped billions of research dollars were being funnelled into, as opposed to job destruction), it looks like content is taking the nosedive of it's life.

2025 ... looks interesting

comments.commentText:
AI is unstoppable like the internet and mobile before; but winning AI market share as a startup is hard with everyone doing AI like a bubble; big tech companies Google, Microsoft, Amazon, etc. may ultimately dominate the AI services, causing the 97% of AI startups to fail. AI is the riskiest bet.

AI contrarian investor: Many people hate AI-generated posts and comments, even wrongly accusing those who use certain words or styles of being AI bots.
So, invest in ways to ban AI use, like mandating the typing of all text by hand and input fields with disabled copy-paste and tool access.

Is it impossible? AI texts may be generated elsewhere and re-typed, so you can make some automation slower, not remote the AI-generated content publishing, unless you introduce a witness, which is impractical.

There may be no way to detect or limit AI content publishing, and it is 97% unlikely that you will make a serious profit from AI unless you're a big tech corporation. So, do not invest in AI or anti-AI; both are unlikely profitable.

posts.name:
Gear Technologies
Gear Technologies
posts.content:
The Arkanoid Simulation shows how Gear.exe redefines what‚Äôs possible for Ethereum Mainnet onchain performance.

All with near-zero gas fees, NO fragmentation and NO latency ‚Üì

What is the Arkanoid Simulation?

It‚Äôs not just a game. It‚Äôs a high-load simulation designed to test onchain performance.

Each ‚Äúgame‚Äù involves intensive calculations‚Äîtracking ball physics, collisions, and game logic‚Äîall processed onchain.

Why does this matter?

- Ethereum struggles with latency and heavy computations due to its gas limits.
- Layer 2 solutions like Arbitrum improve scalability but inherit EVM performance limits and come with fragmentation.

On the other hand...

Gear.exe is an Ethereum network extension that executes multiple simulations in a single block with near-zero gas fees and comes without fragmentation.

The Setup:

We tested the same simulation on:
- Ethereum: Baseline test to measure performance and costs.
- Arbitrum EVM: Cheaper, but same gas logic as Ethereum.
- Arbitrum Nitro: Optimized with WASM, 1,000 iterations per block.
- Gear.exe: Parallel execution of 16 games in a single Ethereum block.

Why Gear.exe stands out:

- Runs 16 high-load simulations simultaneously in a single block.
- Near-zero gas costs and and low latency for massive computations.
- Drastically improved UX: avoids fragmentation and latency on user a side.
- Fully compatible with Ethereum (MetaMask, Etherscan).
- Network extension - value accrual on Ethereum mainnet.

Imagine the possibilities:

This simulation demonstrates that Gear.exe isn‚Äôt just for gaming‚Äîit‚Äôs a game-changer for any high-load computation on Ethereum mainnet.

‚Ä¢ DeFi protocols? Check.
‚Ä¢ Machine learning models? Check.
‚Ä¢ Real-time gaming? Check.

And we kept the receipts to prove it:

comments.commentText:
"Impressive strides in redefining onchain performance!  The Arkanoid Simulation not only highlights Gear.exe‚Äôs groundbreaking capabilities but also opens the door to limitless possibilities for Ethereum Mainnet scalability.
At ITabet, we recognize the immense potential of such advancements in reshaping industries‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs real-time gaming, DeFi, or even machine learning applications.
With our expertise in web development, Android solutions, UI/UX design, and beyond, we‚Äôre excited to see how tools like Gear.exe can further power decentralized applications with seamless user experiences.
Kudos to the team behind this innovative leap! Looking forward to seeing how this transforms high-load computations.

We specialize in creating exceptional e-learning content‚Äîvideos, SCORM packages, simulations, and story-driven training tailored for sales, leadership, and compliance. Our solutions have driven 95% compliance rates and boosted engagement by 35%, helping organizations achieve impactful results.

posts.name:
Natalia Cano
Natalia Cano
posts.content:
The worst advice for anyone struggling in their career:

‚ÄúStay positive"

Yes, it is well-intentioned.

But it can do more harm than good.

Here's why:

 Invalidates Emotions
‚Ü≥ Everyone is allowed to experience disappointment

 Oversimplifies Complex Situations
‚Ü≥ Making people feel like they're failing

 Places the Burden on the Individual
‚Ü≥ Suggesting that a better attitude is the solution

 Dismissive and Insensitive
‚Ü≥ Conveying their struggles aren't being taken seriously

Instead:

Try these 5 supportive actions

(and make a real difference in someone's career):

1. Validate and Acknowledge
‚Ü≥ "It sounds like you're going through a tough time."
‚Ü≥ "Losing a job can be incredibly disappointing."

2. Offer Practical Support
‚Ü≥ "I'm here for you."
‚Ü≥ "How can I support you during this time?"

3. Be Present and Listen
‚Ü≥ "I'm here to listen if you want to talk."
‚Ü≥ "I'm happy to be a sounding board for you."

4. Focus on Understanding:
‚Ü≥ "I can only imagine how challenging this must be."
‚Ü≥ "What are you feeling most concerned about?"

5. Offer Encouragement and Perspective
‚Ü≥ "I know this is a setback, but I also know how resilient you are."
‚Ü≥ "You've overcome challenges before, and I believe you'll navigate this one as well."

Remember:

'Showing up' is more powerful than 'cheering up'.

Do you agree?

Let me know below in the comments

‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ‚Äæ
Ô∏è Repost to share help others offer meaningful support
Follow mefor daily content like this

comments.commentText: Absolutely Natalia Cano. Offering empathy and practical support far outweighs empty platitudes. Acknowledging someone's struggles can create the space they need to heal and move forward.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
